Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i worked at a link shortening company, our apache mysql DB connection count would hover at 700

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and then traffic spikes would make our DB connections go insane and bring down the system

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: moving nginx in front of the apache mod_perls, our db connection count went down to 40

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: didn't think about a specific interface for a potential support team / member that would like to manage it, maybe that would be a good idea, obviously not allowing to gather any secure info, but just for example to show a page printing trades stuck by status. Some can be handled automatically, but some other, that should... never happen, would need investigation. I'm trying to reduce it to the maximum giving "exit points" in case of stuck trade, depending on the status it may involve a specific modal for whatever side needs to ask for a refund (if the trade is stuck). About a way to identify and authorize it, we'll have 2 cases : There was a problem during the sending of any side : It will be handled via cancel module, as nothing has been spent, a refund is one of the way to proceed.
